greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle, row sums = A001595.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 1..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: n-th row = first n Fibonacci terms, with a deletion of F(n).
Columns of the triangle are difference terms of the array in A117501.
T(n,k) = Fibonacci(k) for k < n and T(n,n) = Fibonacci(n+1). - _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 10 2019
example: Row 5 of the triangle = (1, 1, 2, 3, 8); the first 5 Fibonacci terms with a deletion of F(5) = 5.
First few rows of the triangle are:
mathematica: Table[If[k==n, Fibonacci[n+1], Fibonacci[k]], {n, 20}, {k, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 10 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==n, fibonacci(n+1), fibonacci(k)); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 10 2019
(MAGMA) [k eq n select Fibonacci(n+1) else Fibonacci(k): k in [1..n], n in [1..20]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 10 2019
[[T(n, k) for k in (1..n)] for n in (1..20)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 10 2019
Flat(List([1..20], n-> List([1..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 14 2019
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Mar 23 2006
ext: More terms added by _G. C. Greubel_, Jul 10 2019
